servinfo.title: Rear Wheel Hub Assembly Removal and Installation (Rear Disc Brake Model)

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Rear Wheel Hub Assembly and Rear Suspension Knuckle Components

s1.ptxt: Hoist vehicle and remove rear wheel.
Pull up parking brake lever fully and remove rear drive shaft nut (1).
Remove rear brake disc and brake caliper.
Removal rear wheel hub housing bolts (1) and then remove rear wheel hub assembly and back plate.
Refer to Step 8) of Front Wheel Hub Assembly Removal and Installation to remove hub bolts since the rear wheel hub assembly is the same as the front wheel hub assembly.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Rear Wheel Hub Assembly, Wheel Bearing and Wheel Stud Inspection

s1.ptxt: Refer to Step 1) of Front Wheel Hub Assembly Removal and Installation to install hub bolts since the rear wheel hub assembly is the same as the front wheel hub assembly.
Apply grease to end face of inner ring (2) before rear wheel hub (1) installation.

attention2.ptxt: Do not apply the grease to the encoder section to avoid the encoder malfunction.

s1.ptxt: Install rear wheel hub assembly and tighten rear wheel hub housing bolts (1) to specified torque.
Install rear brake disc and brake caliper.
Pull up parking brake lever fully and tighten new rear drive shaft nut (1) to specified torque.

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to use new drive shaft nut.
Otherwise, drive shaft nut may loosen.
Be careful while caulking nut so that no crack will occur in caulked part of nut. Cracked nut must be replaced with new one.

s1.ptxt: Check to ensure that brake drum is free from dragging and proper braking is obtained.
Perform brake test (foot brake and parking brake).
